column4: does anyone have idea of what mkfs.ext3 parameters are used when the installation programa formats the partitions?
it's failuring through the graphical interface, so I want to try it on the console
try the alternate cd?
you can specify the mkfs.ext3 options there
generally "sudo mkfs.ext3 /dev/sda1" or whatever will give you a great working fast ext3 partition
I don't know this "alternate cd"
cool, thanks
I discovered what's wrong: the mkfs.ext3 is telling me that the partition I'm trying to format is mounted.
ah
but in fact it is not. I checked /proc/mounts and mount command. it's not mounted.
any ideas on that?
weird.
uhh what parition?  like /dev/sda2?
/dev/hdb3
is any drive on /dev/hdb mounted?
if so unmount all drives on hdb and try "sudo mkfs.ext3 /dev/hdb3"
there's nothing mounted there. I checked with 'mount' and 'cat /proc/mounts'. no references
okay, im not sre
there is a -F force option
you can try -v to get verbose messages too
yeah, I was reading about '-F' right now.
but gonna try with -v before that ;)
btw, -v is not that verbose. made no difference running mkfs.ext3 with that flag :d
weird. I tried this: mke2fs -j -v -F -F /dev/hdb3. same deal "is mounted".
